comments.author: [eatingclub] vancouver || js
comments.content:
We recently cooked with king oyster mushrooms and I was pleasantly surprised at the flavour and texture. I've had oyster mushrooms and thought the king would be about the same. We cooked it in a Thai basil stirfry with chicken -- and it had a similar texture to chicken! In fact, I found I quite preferred it to the chicken!

Lovely ingredient and I would love it with grilled polenta and pesto. Thanks for sharing.

comments.author: Martin
comments.content:
Mushrooms only $19.99? Bargain! I once saw chanterelles at Whole Wallet for only $39.99.
Lucky me, going to the Bavarian Alps in July where you can get a whole basket for five Euros.
When I lived in Boston Costco briefly carried chanterelles from Canada at an acceptable price - look for them in the Fall. A delight, even when they' don't look perfect.

comments.content: Really delicious. Had to use Portobellos rather than King Oyster/French Horn mushrooms, and also added a little smoked paprika and ume vinegar to the beans. Yum.
